title: Chaos in Guatemala Congress Delays Swearing-In of New President
description: Guatemala’s president-elect insisted he will take office on Sunday afternoon even after congress initially refused to swear in lawmakers for the 2024-2028 period.

title: Fani Willis Defends Attorney Hired for Trump Case Amid Scandal
description: Embattled Fulton County District Attorney Fani Willis took to a church pulpit Sunday to break her silence about an explosive court filing alleging she had a romantic relationship with a special counsel she hired to help lead the election interference prosecution of Donald Trump.

title: Iowa Republican Chair Predicts ‘Robust’ Caucus Turnout
description: Iowa Republican Party Chair Jeff Kaufmann predicted strong turnout for Monday’s caucuses, despite snow storms and frigid temperatures that have curtailed travel in recent days.

title: Xi Stays Clear of Red Sea Battle Despite Risks to China Trade
description: As the US and UK launch airstrikes to stop Iran-backed Houthi rebels from attacking ships in the Red Sea, China again finds itself happily sitting on the sidelines.

title: Zelenskiy to Meet Dimon in Davos as Ukraine Seeks Aid Rebuilding
description: Volodymyr Zelenskiy plans to meet with JPMorgan Chase & Co.’s Jamie Dimon this week at the World Economic Forum as the Ukrainian president seeks to replenish the country’s coffers for its fight against Russia, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Bone-Chilling Cold Is Testing Power Grids From Texas to Alberta
description: An Arctic blast that’s sweeping through North America is heightening the risk of blackouts. With more cold still in the forecast, electric grids from Texas to Alberta will continue to be under strain.

title: UK Police Arrest Six Over Plot to Disrupt London Stock Exchange
description: UK police said they arrested six people over a plot to target the London Stock Exchange.

title: Burgum Endorses Trump For President Ahead of Iowa Caucus
description: North Dakota Governor Doug Burgum endorsed Republican frontrunner Donald Trump for president, a day ahead of the Iowa caucus.

title: Donald Trump With Nigel Farage in Tow Exhorts Iowans to Vote
description: Former President Donald Trump pleaded with his Iowa Republican supporters to brave the frigid weather Monday and turn out in droves to gift him a dominant victory in the state’s caucus and push him closer to a rematch with Joe Biden for the White House.

title: Canada to Weigh Caps on Foreign Students Amid Housing Crunch
description: Canada will consider measures to cap the number of international students in the coming months as the country wrestles with a housing shortage.

title: US, UK Fighter Jets Strike Again in Yemen, Al-Masirah TV Says
description: Houthi rebels in Yemen said US and UK fighter jets hit Jadaa mountain in Al-Lahayah district in the Red Sea province of Hodeida in a new strike Sunday evening.

title: Ecuador Security Forces Secure Release of All Prison Hostages
description: Ecuador’s national police and the military secured the release of the remaining prison guards and staff that had been held hostage amid a wave of violence across the country, the nation’s prison authority said.

title: Taiwan Election Result to Force Compromise in Boost for Markets
description: The ruling Democratic Progressive Party’s victory in Taiwan’s presidential election Saturday removes key uncertainties for local markets, analysts said, noting China’s muted response and the prospect of major parties having to cooperate on policy.

title: Larry Hogan Says It’s Time for Republicans to Get Behind Haley
description: Former Maryland Governor Larry Hogan urged the Republican party to support presidential candidate Nikki Haley, curbing speculation that he could run on a third-party ticket.

title: The Green Investor Calling Out Biden’s Climate Law for Enriching Bankers and Consultants
description: One of the world’s biggest green investment managers is voicing frustration over some key features of President Joe Biden’s landmark climate law.

title: Anti-Corruption Campaigner Defended by Washington to Take Office as Guatemala President
description: Anti-corruption campaigner Bernardo Arevalo takes over as Guatemala’s president on Sunday after the US State Department helped him face down a campaign to block him from office.

title: US Economy Set for Another Cash Boost If Congress Backs Tax Deal
description: The US economy is set for an unexpected fiscal boost if lawmakers back a potential deal for $70 billion worth of tax breaks for businesses and families.

title: Frigid Weather Hammering the US Threatens to Upend Iowa Voting
description: Frigid weather gripping the US has snarled travel, disrupted the National Football League playoffs and now threatens to alter the course of the 2024 presidential election.

title: Sunak to Brief on Yemen, Elite Head to Davos: UK Sunday Briefing
description: Welcome back. Here’s what we’re talking about heading into the new week:

title: Xi’s Taiwan Strategy in Tatters After Winnable Vote Slips Away
description: The moment Chinese President Xi Jinping’s prospects fell apart for a favorable outcome in Taiwan’s election came not this weekend, but at a luxury hotel in downtown Taipei on a Thursday evening in November.

title: Desperate Gazans Use Crowdsourcing to Bribe Their Way Into Egypt
description: As they endure missiles, displacement, disease and starvation, some Gazans are raising money online to pay bribes to Egyptian officials at the Rafah border to get family members out to safety.

title: Ex-US Officials Set to Meet Taiwan Politicians, Testing China
description: A delegation of former top US officials is set to arrive in Taiwan to meet leading political figures, testing a recent improvement of ties between Washington and Beijing.

title: King Frederik X to Take Danish Throne as Mother Abdicates
description: On Sunday, Denmark will witness the first abdication in nearly 900 years, when Queen Margrethe II makes way for her son, who assumes the royal moniker King Frederik X.

title: North Korea Fires Suspected Ballistic Missile, Its First of 2024
description: North Korea fired a suspected ballistic missile Sunday, its first such launch of 2024, amid a pledge by leader Kim Jong Un to boost the country’s nuclear-strike capabilities.

title: Agrarians at the Gate Lead the Revolt Against Olaf Scholz
description: At 5 a.m. on Monday, Cynthia Frey will climb into her 300-horsepower tractor and drive through the dark to the center of Berlin. There she’ll join hundreds of other farmers at the Brandenburg Gate and call for Chancellor Olaf Scholz to resign.

title: Ukraine Peace Proposal Talks Set for Davos in Bid for Visibility
description: Ukraine aims to leverage the annual gathering of political and business leaders in Davos this week to rekindle support and attention for its fight against Russia’s invasion.

title: Taiwan Condemns China’s ‘Wild Fallacy’ Over Democratic Vote
description: Taiwan blasted China’s claims that the island’s election was an internal affair for President Xi Jinping’s government as ridiculous, after Beijing criticized the democratic vote.

title: Billionaire Bill Ackman Backs Dean Phillips to Challenge Biden
description: Billionaire Bill Ackman said he’s contributing $1 million to support Minnesota Representative Dean Phillips to become the Democratic nominee in the 2024 presidential election.

title: DeSantis Seeks to Quell Donor Worries Days Ahead of Iowa Caucus
description: Florida Governor Ron DeSantis’s presidential campaign sought to reassure donors that his operation in Iowa is strong enough to mobilize voters, even as a new poll shows him losing support and frigid temperatures threaten to dampen caucus turnout.

title: Trump Leads With 48% in Iowa Poll Two Days Before Caucus
description: Former President Donald Trump goes into the Iowa caucuses Monday with 48% support, according to an NBC News/Des Moines Register poll of likely Republican voters released Saturday.

title: India Opposition Leader Begins Two-Month Trek Ahead of Elections
description: The leader of India’s main opposition party, the Indian National Congress, will set off on a march Sunday that will see him traverse the breath of the country — from the eastern state of Manipur to Maharashtra in the west.

title: House, Senate Working on Stopgap Funding Deal as Shutdown Looms
description: Congressional leaders are working on a renewed stopgap spending agreement to keep the federal government funded into March, potentially averting a shutdown starting Jan. 20.

title: Ecuador Says Some Prison Guards, Staffers Held Hostage Now Free
description: Twenty-four prison guards and 17 staffers taken hostage in Ecuador this week were released Saturday, according to a statement from the nation’s prison authority posted on X.

title: Yemen’s Houthi Rebels Hold Military Drills Near Saudi Border
description: Yemen’s Houthi rebels carried out a military drill Saturday in the province of Saada near Saudi Arabia after strikes by the US and allied forces, the rebel-run Al-Masirah TV reported.

title: Chad’s Military Ruler Secures Ex-Ruling Party Backing Ahead of 2024 Vote
description: Chad’s military ruler was sworn in as the former ruling party’s honorary president, positioning him as its likely candidate in the 2024 presidential polls.
